sentence.text: Creaks and squeaks in plumbing pipes can be caused by hot water or central heating pipes expanding as they heat up .
Huy listened to him descending them , then the soft creak and click of the door .
Travis stood up , accompanied by an ominous creak and a shudder of the plane .
Half a minute later the airframe gave one final creak and his stomach fell away as the Hercules lifted off , whining into the night sky .
The creak and click of door and padlock roused Midnight .
Then only the slapping of waves against the hull , the creak and whine of timbers straining , the screech of gulls .
He heard her steps in the passageway , heard the creak of the door .
A car engine throbbed , people called greetings , there was the creak of shutters opening in one flat and the sound of a radio in another .
Flora listened as she rode to the bits jingling , the creak of leather , the brush-brush of the horses ' hooves through the grass , the croak of a carrion crow in the valley .
It spoke words ; they were high-pitched and meaningless : bird chatter ; the creak of a branch ; more chatter ; the rustle of leaves in wind .
She was sure if she listened hard enough she would be able to hear the creak of the rocking-horse the girl had been given as a Christmas present a month ago .
Then she felt a breath of air and the creak of the door she had n't altogether shut and which led out to the courtyard .
The shrill creak of the hinges as we were closed into the suffocating darkness of that cliff-top grave was a terrifying sound .
She glanced round as Melissa entered , alerted by the creak of the heavy wooden door , but immediately returned to her task of removing faded blooms and replacing them with fresh ones .

He turned towards Byrne 's cork-blackened face and pressed his lips to his ear , where he whispered so softly that the creak of his tongue against teeth and palate was louder than the words themselves .
The creak of a pump-handle and the answering gush of water made him feel his own thirst and taste his tongue 's rancid dryness .
At last she heard the creak of footsteps on the stairs , and hardly dared breathe until he closed his own room door .
There was a creak of splintering wood as the tall man prized off the lid of the crate .
Then , the sound so magnified by the water that it made us start , came the click and creak of a door opening nearby , and the soft ripple of a boat moving through the water .
Laura and I sat in tense silence , listening to the creak of the stairs .
Alexei heard a single splash as a loosened rope fell into the water , and then there came the creak of settling timbers .
For a while now there 'd been no sound save the lazy creak of the sails and the soft slap of water against their bows .
There was a loud creak like the noise of the gates as the door opened .
He drew back the groaning bolts and turned the rusty iron ring , and the door opened inwards with a protesting creak .
